alert.note: Alert for Bryan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 4:53PM CST until December 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Blue River near Blue affecting Bryan County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Blue River near Blue. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, The river remains largely within its banks... throughout Bryan County. Inflows from local streams could cause minor overflows to reach very low fields for a short while. Only farmlands are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The Blue River is expected to rise to a crest of 27.0 feet this evening. - Action stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM CST.
